name: Puffin
description:
A small bird with an orange beak and flippers, patterned as though dressed in a black and white suit.
This variety of bird mostly dwells on island cliffs and coastal areas, building nests by digging holes or using natural clefts and crevices in rock. Don't be fooled by the way it staggers clumsily about on foot. When it takes flight, those strong wings are sure to surprise!
